title: Casino Night
description: The Dunder Mifflin crew holds a casino party at the warehouse and Michael has two dates.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight the Scranton Business Park is having Casino Night and we are converting our warehouse into a full-blown gambling hall. And I know it's illegal in Pennsylvania, but it's for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer. It's just... It's nice to know at the end of the day, I can look in the mirror and say, "Michael, because of you, some little kid in the Congo has a belly full of rice this evening." Makes you feel good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Excuse me. How long is the wait for a table for two?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would never, ever serve you. Not in a million, billion years.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know. It belonged to my grandfather. He was buried in it, so family heirloom.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So, what's the deal? We gotta pay for our own drinks? That's lame.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Come on, it'll be fun, and besides, I'm a roulette expert.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impossible. Roulette is not a game of skill, it is a game of chance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can always kind of win at roulette.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] You can't be serious. Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ever since I was a little kid, like, eight or nine, I could sort of control things with my mind.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was just little thing, you know, like I could make something shake or I could make a marble fall off the counter. You know, just little things.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] That's ridiculous. You know what? Uh... Why don't you move that coat rack? Excuse me, everyone! Attention in the office, please. Jim is about to prove his telekinetic powers and he needs absolute silence. Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'll try. [The coat rack wobbles] [Pam holds up an umbrella handle to the camera in another scene]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I try not to think of it as lagging behind. It's more of a David-and-Goliath thing.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [on phone] Yeah, but... Well, the fact of the matter is that your branch is currently number four of the five branches that I oversee.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know that I'm very serious here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan, listen, I promise that I will kick it up a notch. Bam!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Emeril. Oh, actually, while I have you, not that I have you or have ever had you, but we're having our Casino Night tonight and I think everyone would love to see their fearless leader here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I thought that you were their fearless leader.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am, but you are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [laughs] I think you can handle it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, it'd be fun. I can hear it in your voice. You need a break.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan and I understand each other. The romance thing is sort of on hold for the time being, but we've remained good friends. Good friends with privileges. Not now, some day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, everybody. Tonight's event is to benefit the Boy Scouts of America.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Again? We do that every year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, they need our money. They don't have cookies like the Girl Scouts.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It'd be nice to do something for people who are actually suffering.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Oscar, if you don't like it, then you should concentrate on winning. Because the person at the end of the evening with the highest chip count will receive $500 to donate to the charity of their choice. And they will get a mini-fridge compliments of Vance Refrigeration.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So get your charities in to Pam. I, for example, am playing for Comic Relief.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Comedy is very much alive, as are homeless people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, they stopped making that show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then, they need our money more than ever.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You have to pick an approved, non-profit organization.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: There's a great soup kitchen in downtown Scranton. Delicious pea soup on Thursdays. I'll probably give the money to them.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Kobe Bryant has a foundation, and he is so hot. And he gave his wife the biggest diamond ring. I know he didn't do it. ...Maybe he did it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We are giving money that has been gambled. Why don't we just deal drugs or prostitute ourselves,  and donate that money to charity?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, and another fun thing. We, at the end of the night, are going to give the check to an actual group of Boy Scouts. Right, Toby? We're gonna...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Actually, I didn't think it was appropriate to invite children since it's... You know, there's gambling and alcohol, and it's in our dangerous warehouse and it's a school night... And, you know, Hooters is catering. You know, is that enough? Should I keep going?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why are you the way that you are? Honestly, every time I try to do something fun or exciting, you make it not... that way. I hate so much about the things that you choose to be. Okay, you know what? I will not donate my winnings to Comic Relief, since apparently it doesn't exist. I am going to donate to Afghanistanis with AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you mean the aid to Afghanistan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I mean Afghanistanis with AIDS.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, you know what? No. No. AIDS is not funny. Believe me, I have tried.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are certain topics that are off-limits to comedians, JFK, AIDS, the Holocaust. The Lincoln Assassination just recently became funny. "I need to see this play like I need a hole in the head." [laughs] And I hope to someday live in a world where a person could tell a hilarious AIDS joke. It's one of my dreams.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Roy was supposed to pick the band, but he's concentrating more on the bachelor party now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait, wait, where you going? I mean, even if you don't hire a band, you still have to watch the bands. Pam, these are people who have never given up on their dreams. I have great respect for that. And, yes, they're all probably very bad and that will make me feel better about not having dreams.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's a KISS cover band in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm pretty happy these days. I'm getting married soon and I'm getting along with everybody at work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why did I talk to Jan about transferring? Well, you know... I have no future here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have already put down the deposit. Do you understand how a deposit works?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, I am not having fire-eaters in a paper warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's Casino Night like Las Vegas. There are fire-eaters all over the place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually, it's owned by Beakman Properties, and Dunder Mifflin is four years into a seven-year lease.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When Darryl was coming, you said you wanted me here for protection.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We just have a lot of stuff down there that could be stolen.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I taught Mike some, uh, phrases to help with his interracial conversations. You know, stuff like, "Fleece it out." "Going mach five." "Dinkin' flicka." You know, things us Negroes say.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Give me some. [Michael and Darryl perform simultaneous hand gesture]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I taught him a handshake, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim ejects a videotape from the VCR and puts in a new one] Wow. I don't know how you're gonna decide. They are all extremely good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think I should hire them all. Do like Lollapalooza.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your mom would love that. She would. Oh, this band is called Scrantonicity.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, wait. That's Kevin. On the drums.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: On the drums! On the drums!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God, that's Kevin! Great song, Kev. Oh,  my God, he's the drummer and the singer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We really don't do a lot of weddings. We actually don't play in public very often. We are all really hoping that Pam's wedding works out. This could be a turning point for the band.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you haven't seen that since 1983. That is amazing. Okay, we have to sign him. I'm gonna call the label, we're gonna...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Pam, you're gonna lose him to another wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, come back! No, no, no!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim is great. Being with him just takes away all the stress of planning my wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [phone rings] Michael, Carol Stills for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I know a Carol Stills?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, put her through. Hey Carol, how goes the real estate biz? Is it real good?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes I don't put Michael through until he's already said something. I look at it as a practice run for him. He usually does better on the second attempt.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: I'm great. I just needed one last signature for your mortgage insurance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey, no problemo. Incidentally, I love the place.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great. It has a little bit of a weird smell. It's okay. At Christmas, the tree helped.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Oh, good, I'm glad. Can I drop it over later?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Actually, I'm sort of hosting this charity thing in our warehouse, Casino Night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it'll be good. You know what? Why don't you come by? Bring the papers, I'll sign them and then you can stay and have a drink.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. It'll be fun. What do you...[phone rings] What do you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Could you hold on? Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, put her through. [Deep voice] Jan Levinson, I presume?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's still me. Uh, Jan, here's Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know, I... I thought about it and you are right.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I could use a little fun. So, I am going to drive up for your Casino Night.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Okay, then. I will see you tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye Hello, Carol? Hi, sorry about that. I just...

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: I have to get a sitter, but that shouldn't be a problem.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: And I'll bring the papers, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Two queens on Casino Night. I am going to drop a deuce on everybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [People playing casino games as the actual Casino Night begins] Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Thanks. Thank you for inviting me. It looks so great in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, well... Kiss. [Michael kisses her on the cheek, pauses and then kisses her on the other cheek] That's how we do it in the paper biz. It's European and... Yes? Ah, Dwight [Kisses cheeks]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Code name Re/Max is here. No sign of Lan Jevinson.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm Michael's wingman. I've got his back. Two dates. He's got two dates tonight. My job is to keep Jan away from Carol and vice versa. Michael said, "We must deceive them, so as not to hurt them, and in that way, we honor them."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I get you a drink? The food is from Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, I steal things all the time. It's just something I do. I stopped caring a long time ago. You should see how many supplies I've taken from this place. Honestly, I love stealing things.

quotes.speaker: {Billy}'s Girlfriend
quotes.text: I'm gonna get a drink. Do you need anything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your nurse became your girlfriend? Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: She was never my nurse. I met her at Chili's. She was my waitress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welkommen, Bienvenue, and welcome to Monte Carlo! Dwight. I am no longer your boss. Lady Fortune is your boss.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [Under his breath] Will Lady Fortune give me a raise?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut it, shut it, shut it. Will Lady Fortune be your mistress? Only time will tell, my friends. Leave all your preconceived notions about casinos at the door. Old friends, new lovers, and the disabled!  Welcome all! Great, okay. Shuffle up and deal. Let's get it started! Black-Eyed Crows.

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: Okay, the game is No-Limit Texas Hold'em. Good luck, everybody. That's at least four red chips to you, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bluffing is a key part of poker, which is too bad, because I'm not very good at bluffing. Did you believe me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, Toby, I went all-in on the first hand, so doesn't that tell you that I might have good cards, too? So don't be stupid. Just take it back.

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: No, I'm sorry. He can't, sir. He's gone all-in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You really screwed that up. [Michael leaves]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't really play cards, but I'm not gonna lie to you. It felt really good to take money from Michael. Gonna chase that feeling.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I expect to do very well tonight. I have an acute ability to read people. Jim, for instance, has a huge tell. When he gets a good hand, he coughs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [coughs] I will raise. [Dwight sighs and folds his cards] Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's the weirdest thing. Every time I cough, he folds.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, whatever. Hey, you know what? If luck weren't involved, I would always be winning. [Sees Jan] Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, okay, I think we're all adults here, and it has always been my understanding that we have an open relationship.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What are you... Just... Wait, what're you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: After you said you weren't coming, I invited Carol to come and I don't think that I did anything wrong.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: No. No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Jan. I'm Michael's boss.

quotes.speaker: Billy
quotes.text: It's all on you, baby. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good evening, Dwight. What is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Evening, Angela. This is craps. I need to roll an eight. If I do, everyone wins.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah! Yeah! [Kisses Angela, she slaps him and walks away smiling]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dwight, let's keep it going. Let's keep it going. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Let it ride. Let it all ride.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mhmm, And I'm gonna take you all-in.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I think she's full of it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Pam. Jim Halpert, ladies and gentlemen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you very much. It was fun.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Can I get a red wine? So, two hours? That's a long drive.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, it's part of the job, you know? Keep an eye on things. So... Why not? So, how long have you and Michael been...

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Oh, well, actually, I guess this would be our first date. I guess.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Casino Night in the warehouse. Good sport.

quotes.speaker: Carrol
quotes.text: Well, I'm having a nice time.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: One beer and one Seven and Seven with eight maraschino cherries, sugar on the rim, blended if you can.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, that's still going on, huh? You and Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Dealer
quotes.text: The point is four. Shooter, roll it. Four!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Four! [Holds dice in front of Carol] Blow. Blow for luck! Yeah! Also, you. Not playing favorites. [Holds dice in front of Jan] All right, here we go!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. [Turns to Jan] So where you staying? Radisson?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Holiday Inn? The Hyatt in Wilkes-Barre? You staying with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I won the 2002 $2,500 No-Limit Deuce-to-Seven-Draw Tournament at the World Series of Poker in Vegas. So, yeah... I'm pretty good at poker.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, thank you, Bobby. But it doesn't matter, it's just fun to play.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Look, I won! Look I have all the clovers! You wanna play again?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I do not want to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, I saw your tape. Your band, Scrantonicity? You guys rock.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah, you guys wanna play our wedding?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Awesome. Did Pam say it was okay?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Whatever. I'm in charge of the music.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dude, you will not be sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Fabulous time. I drove two and a half hours to get here.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Left work early, drove down here. And I am completely underdressed

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I think you look great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why did I hook up with Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: It was very late, Jim. Very... Very late and... Have you given any more thought to the transfer?

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: Excuse me. Big moment. The evening's chip leader and winner of this beautiful mini-refrigerator courtesy of Vance Refrigeration, Creed Bratton, Dunder Mifflin!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Thanks. I never owned a refrigerator.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Sorry, babe. I am just beat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's okay. I'll see you at home.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Okay. Hey, don't try to lose too much money, all right?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: If you still want a honeymoon. Hey, Halpert. Keep an eye on her, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good, especially after I took all your money in poker.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Hey, can I talk to you about something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: About when you want to give me more of your money?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you wanna do that now? We can go inside. I'm feeling kind of good tonight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was just... I'm in love with you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm really sorry if that's weird for you to hear, but I needed you to hear it. Probably not good timing, I know that. I just...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing? What do you expect me to say to that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just needed you to know. Once.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I um... I... I can't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on. I don't wanna do that. I wanna be more than that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't. I'm really sorry if you misinterpreted things. It's probably my fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not your fault. I'm sorry I misinterpreted our friendship.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, I just wanted to congratulate you on a fantastic evening. You did the company proud.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And thanks for inviting me. You were right, I needed it. So, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: And you guys have a good time together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good night. She's a good boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Love triangle. Drama. All worked out in the end, though. The hero got the girl. Who saw that coming? I did. And Jan was really happy for me. So actually the hero got two girls. He got the girl that he works with and he got the girl that he buys real estate from. So, I've got my New York girl and my local flavor. Life is good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [On phone] About 10 minutes ago. No, I didn't know what to say.  Yes, I know.  Um, I don't know, mom, he's my best friend.  Yeah, he's great.  Yeah, I think I am. [Jim enters] I have to go. I will. Listen, Jim... [They kiss]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, in the conference room now, please. Thank you. Time is money.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Should I get water or donuts?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, let's go. Take a seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want somebody to give me the name of one of our biggest competitors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Yes, that will work. All right. Now I need a plural noun. [All groaning]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Apparently Michael has come up with a Dunder Mifflin Mad Lib, and he's making us play it with him. We are so happy. No. I'd like to choose a different adjective.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I am going back to my desk...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. No, no, not until you give me an adjective.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Toby, damn it, come on! We already have that. I need something fun. Something like fat or smelly. Or pukey. Pukey. Pukey's good. Okay. Pukey. Now I need a noun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Thank you, Phyllis. That wasn't so hard. All right, here we go. "Office Depot is an annoying store. One day Creed went there to buy paper. And he ran into irritating Cylons."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "One of them was named Michael Scott, and he was an..." Oh, damn it. Okay. Okay, okay, we're... Okay, we're starting over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My charity is the Farm Defense Fund. It's one of the best organizations that fights infestation of the beet armyworm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My charity is the Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff's Department, because Dwight's a Volunteer Sheriff. So I thought this was a perfect opportunity to support/mock him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't believe that Jim moved that coat rack. But if he did, he has an obligation to use his gift wisely. With great power comes great responsibility. They could do a cross-section of his brain to find out more. But I don't think it's true, though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, if anything goes missing, we will reimburse.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. Can Dunder Mifflin afford that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dang! Paper making paper, I.e. money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Paper money. [clears throat] Yeah. The company's doing fine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, we're not shipping as much as we did last year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Okay. You know what? Don't even think. I command you to just go down and have fun tonight. All right? Don't think about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Our numbers are down, yes, but we have a heck of a crew here in Scranton. Hardworking, motivated, dynamic. Every single last one of them. They follow my lead. I sort of set the tone. And it doesn't hurt that my ex works for corporate. Jan loves this branch, and I think that's really more than half the battle.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It is extremely stressful, planning a wedding by yourself. It's like a job. I mean, it's fun, but it kind of becomes like work. I've already planned it all out in my head. But it's just in my head.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh, God. Oh, no. I have this problem all the time. I never remember people I've had sex with.

quotes.speaker: {Meredith}'s Vet
quotes.text: And we had sex in the parking lot.
